main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Troy Hill, Whippany, New Jersey on August 13, 1958. The object was elliptical in shape with brilliant steady lights underneath and diffused lights on the top side.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 12 seconds, and it was described as a very brilliant object that came from the west-northwest and disappeared in the southwest.
Two other individuals also reported seeing a UFO on August 4, 1958, in Lake George, New York and in Rockaway, New Jersey.
The witnesses' credibility seems to be acknowledged, as the report was sent through official channels to the Air Technical Intelligence Center.
The conclusion suggested various possibilities such as a probable meteor, balloon, aircraft, or astronomical event.
An intelligence officer speculated that the sighting could be a falling star, fireworks display, or experimental testing at a nearby U.S. Army arsenal.
sighted object: elliptical UFO with brilliant and diffused lights
witnesses: Troy Hill resident and two other individuals from New York and New Jersey
